vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 82; A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions.

vote.question: On the Motion
vote.title: Motion to Waive All Applicable Budgetary Discipline Re: H.R. 82; A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3331
vote.title: Crapo Amdt. No. 3331; To delay the repeal of the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions until additional changes are made to offset any negative impacts on the actuarial balance of the Social Security Trust Funds.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3360
vote.title: Cruz Amdt. No. 3360; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3352
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 3352; To provide for automatic continuing resolutions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3346
vote.title: Paul Amdt. No. 3346; To adjust the normal and early retirement ages for Social Security benefits and increase the maximum age for delayed retirement credits.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 7888; A bill to reform the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1840
vote.title: Lee Amdt No. 1840; To appropriately address the use of amici curiae in Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court proceedings and to require adequate disclosure of relevant information in Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 applications.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1841
vote.title: Durbin Amdt No. 1841 as Modified; To prohibit warrantless access to the communications and other information of United States persons.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1828
vote.title: Paul Amdt No. 1828; To prohibit the use of authorities under the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to surveil United States persons, to prohibit queries under such Act using search terms associated with United States persons, and to prohibit the use of information acquired under such Act in any criminal, civil, or administrative proceeding or as part of any criminal, civil, or administrative investigation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1820
vote.title: Wyden Amdt No. 1820; To strike section 25, relating to definition of electronic communication service provider.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1834
vote.title: Marshall Amdt No. 1834; To strike the prohibition on political appointees being involved in the approval of queries by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 1829
vote.title: Paul Amdt No. 1829; To append the Fourth Amendment Is Not For Sale Act.

vote.question: On the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Proceed to H.R. 7888; A bill to reform the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 4072; A bill to prohibit the use of funds to implement, administer, or enforce certain rules of the Environmental Protection Agency.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture: Motion to Proceed to H.R. 7888; A bill to reform the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978.

vote.title: Paul Amendment No. 1384; To limit foreign assistance to the Palestinian Authority or any other Palestinian governing entity in the West Bank and Gaza.

vote.question: On Cloture on the Motion to Proceed
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture: Motion to Proceed to H.R. 2872; To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow the Secretary of the Interior to issue electronic stamps under such Act, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table
vote.title: Motion to Table the Motion to Discharge S. Res. 504 from the Committee on Foreign Relations; A resolution requesting information on Israel's human rights practices pursuant to section 502B(c) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation: Erika L. McEntarfer, of D.C., to be Commissioner of Labor Statistics

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture: Erika L. McEntarfer to be Commissioner of Labor Statistics

vote.question: On Overriding the Veto
vote.title: Shall the Joint Resolution (S.J. Res. 32) Pass, the Objections of the President of the United States to the Contrary Notwithstanding? ; A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)".

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation: S. Kato Crews, of Colorado, to be U.S. District Judge for the District of Colorado

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture: S. Kato Crews to be U.S. District Judge for the District of Colorado

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation: John A. Kazen, of Texas, to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Texas

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture: John A. Kazen to be U.S. District Judge for the Southern District of Texas
